message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DB, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the design and implementation of an information theoretically secure database system, which involves aspects of cryptography (cs.CR), database systems (cs.DB), information theory (cs.IT), and algorithms/data structures (cs.DS, cs.CC). The paper's abstract mentions the construction of a "re-randomizing database," which suggests a focus on cryptography and security (cs.CR). The paper also discusses the maintenance of the database and the efficient access of user data, which are topics related to database systems (cs.DB). The security guarantee is information theoretic, which falls under the purview of information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper proposes a realization of the database system and proves its security, which involves the use of algorithms and data structures (cs.DS, cs.CC).
